DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to compare results obtained with epidermal cell spray and classic skin grafting for epidermal replacement in acute burns
DOC.brief_title: Epidermal Cells Delivery and Acute Burns
DOC.detailed_description: Comparing the impact in terms of cicatrisation duration and costs between 2 treatments of deep 2nd and 3rd degree burns. Determine if the costs of the innovating treatment RECELL®, a priori more expensive, are counterbalanced by a shorter cicatrisation duration and an improved evolution versus a conventional strategy. Give an information about efficiency improvement of RECELL® with additional costs
DOC.criteria: Thermal burns requiring surgical debridement Area involved < 1260cm² local or systemic infection conditions that would interfere with wound healing (diabetes, hypertension, inflammatory diseases treated by corticoids) hypersensitivity to trypsin
